title: Warm autumn-sunset theme refresh for landing page (no behavior changes)

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive warm autumn-sunset color system and matching surfaces/borders/accents across the existing homepage sections (header, highlights, upload, gallery, dialogs, footer) without changing functionality.
acceptanceCriteria: No backend changes are required to achieve the theme update.
The overall app color system reads as warm autumn sunset (no blue/purple-forward palette).
Buttons, cards, alerts, borders, and hover states remain accessible with sufficient contrast in both light and dark mode.
Existing page structure and behaviors remain intact: header navigation scroll, hero CTAs scroll, upload flow, gallery list, and photo viewer dialog all still work.

file_operations.description: Retune the global OKLCH design tokens to a cohesive warm autumn-sunset palette (amber/orange/copper/burgundy) for light and dark mode (background/card/muted/border/accent/ring/chart tokens), ensuring contrast remains accessible and removing any blue/purple-forward chart/accent hues. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align root-level Tailwind base tokens (if used by the project build) with the same warm autumn-sunset palette to avoid mismatched surfaces/borders between entry styling layers. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust landing page section wrapper and footer surface/border utility classes to better express the warm autumn theme (surfaces, borders, subtle tints) while keeping all structure and behaviors unchanged. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update header surface, border, and accent treatments (sticky background tint, icon badge surface, hover states) to match the autumn-sunset theme while preserving existing smooth-scroll navigation behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update highlights section background tint and card styling (surface translucency, borders, icon badge accents) to match the warm palette while keeping content and layout unchanged. Uses existing shadcn-ui Card components—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Retheme upload card, dropzone border/hover states, progress, and success/error alert surfaces to warm autumn tones without altering upload logic or validation. Uses existing shadcn-ui components (Card/Button/Alert/Progress)—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update gallery tile hover shadows/overlays and empty-state surfaces to warm sunset styling while preserving image loading, click-to-view behavior, and existing states (loading/error/empty). Uses existing shadcn-ui Card/Skeleton/Alert—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update dialog content surface, border, and muted areas to match the warm autumn palette while preserving dialog behavior, scroll area behavior, and displayed metadata. Uses existing shadcn-ui Dialog/ScrollArea—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update hero styling (overlays/gradients/text emphasis) to a warm sunset with subtle drifting-leaves feel, keeping CTA smooth-scroll behavior unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero background overlay and gradients are updated to warm sunset tones (e.g., amber-to-burgundy) and do not wash out the headline/CTAs.
Hero headline, subheadline, and CTA buttons remain readable on common screen sizes.
CTA buttons still smooth-scroll to #upload-section and #gallery-section as they do currently.

file_operations.description: Replace/edit the existing hero background image to an autumn sunset scene with a subtle falling leaves motif and warm grain, keeping the same filename and dimensions: frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-collage-bg.dim_1600x900.png.

Update hero overlay layering and gradients to warm amber/orange/copper/burgundy tones, tune headline emphasis color to fit the theme, and ensure CTA buttons remain readable and keep their existing smooth-scroll handlers unchanged. Uses existing shadcn-ui Button component—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
